content: The "Business Improvement Act of 1993" allows contracts awarded to program participants before the enactment of the Act to be considered for business activity targets under the Small Business Act. SEC. 3. PROCUREMENT PROCEDURES. Section 8 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow participating agencies to enter into contracts with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals through restricted competition or a price preference of up to 10 percent. The Small Business Act allows participating agencies to enter into contracts with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals through restricted competition or a price preference of up to 10 percent until September 30, 2000. ELIGIBILITY OF PAST DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS FOR SECTION 8(a) CONTRACT AWARDS. Section (8)(a)(1)(C) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow awarding contracts to small businesses owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals who have completed their Program Participation period as prescribed by section 7(j)(15). This applies to both competitive and sole source awards. The Small Business Act allows contracts to be awarded to small businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals who have completed their Program Participation period. This applies to both competitive and sole source awards. Eligibility for contract awards is based on the date specified for receipt of offers in competitive awards and the date of submission of certifications and representations in sole source awards. SEC. 5 amends Section 8(a)(1) of the Small Business Act by removing competitive contracts and SEC. 6 ensures continued access to business opportunities. Section 8(a)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to require competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency if there is a reasonable expectation of offers from 2 or more eligible small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals capable of performing the contract. The Small Business Act now requires competition for contracts if there are offers from 2 or more eligible small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals capable of performing the contract. The Small Business Act mandates competition for contracts among eligible small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals capable of performing the contract. Participating agencies must restrict competition for contracts to ensure compliance with the Act. The Small Business Act mandates competition for contracts among eligible small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals. Participating agencies must restrict competition for contracts to ensure compliance with the Act, including awarding contracts to small business concerns that have graduated from the small business and capital ownership development program. The Small Business Act mandates competition for contracts among eligible small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals. Small business concerns must subcontract 20-50% of the contract value to other small businesses in restricted competitions. The Small Business Act requires small business concerns to subcontract 20-50% of the contract value to other small businesses in restricted competitions. The head of a participating agency must ensure compliance after the contract is completed. The Small Business Act mandates subcontracting requirements for small businesses in restricted competitions, with the head of a participating agency ensuring compliance post-contract completion. This includes follow-on contracts for similar products or services awarded under the program's authority. The term 'participating agency' refers to any Federal agency, and 'small business' is defined as a business with up to 1500 employees. SEC. 7. STUDY OF DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM PARTICIPATION TERMS BY INDUSTRY SECTOR; SUSPENSION OF DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM GRADUATIONS. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a short-term study to determine program participation terms by industry sector for small businesses. Results of the study must be transmitted to specific government bodies within 1 year. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a short-term study on program participation terms by industry sector for small businesses. Results of the study must be transmitted to specific government bodies within 1 year. Additionally, the development program graduations may be suspended for small business concerns participating in certain programs or activities. The Small Business Act is amended to suspend development program graduations for small businesses participating in specific programs or activities. The Small Business Act is amended to allow continued participation in programs or activities until final regulations are issued, based on industry sector studies conducted pursuant to section 10(i). The Small Business Act is amended to allow continued participation in programs or activities until final regulations are issued, based on industry sector studies conducted pursuant to section 10(i). Participation and eligibility would expire based on the requirements of this subsection. SEC. 8. COMPLIANCE WITH BUY INDIAN ACT. Federal agencies contracting with the Small Business Administration under section 8(a) for goods or services from economically disadvantaged Indian tribes are considered compliant with the Buy Indian Act. SEC. 9. UNIFORM PROCEDURES FOR CONTESTING STATUS OF CONCERNS. "Section 16 of the Small Business Act is amended to establish uniform procedures for contesting the status of a concern as a 'small business concern owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals' within 120 days of enactment."
